body.ab: Letter from Paris, in the N.Y. World.
body.add: I have been surprised, however, in visiting the hospitals of Paris at the morning hour, when the most learned and experienced physicians of the capital go through the wards and prescribe for the patients, at observing the small quantity, and often almost inoperative character, of the medicines they prescribe. Diet, nursing, and the good care of the devoted sisters of charity, who attend to the wants of the eighty thousand patients who annually pass through the hospitals of Paris, seem to be now much more depended upon to effect cures, than the contents of the apothecaries' gallipots.292A
